channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13419] Thrift gateway should propagate text from exception causes.
item.description:
Exceptions passed back from the thrift gateway only include the message text of the toplevel exception. Information from the cause chain is lost.

In some cases, the top-level exception text is useless but there is some very specific and useful information provided in some of the cause exceptions, so it would be very helpful to flatten all of the messages into the exception text returned to the user.
item.summary: Thrift gateway should propagate text from exception causes.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
From 475978873c0bf0bcad5a10e371f20d8191f3f582 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Michael Muller <mmuller@google.com>
Date: Tue, 7 Apr 2015 10:57:46 -0400
Subject: [PATCH] Expand the exception causes in the thrift gateway.

Expand the full chain of exception causes when passing an error back up to a
thrift client so useful information doesn't get lost when the exception is
flattened.
—
.../hadoop/hbase/thrift/ThriftServerRunner.java | 93 +++++++++++++---------
.../hadoop/hbase/thrift/TestThriftServerUnit.java | 39 +++++++++
2 files changed, 95 insertions, 37 deletions
create mode 100644 hbase-thrift/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift/TestThriftServerUnit.java

{ getAdmin().enableTable(getTableName(tableName)); }

catch (IOException e)

{ LOG.warn(e.getMessage(), e); - throw new IOError(e.getMessage()); + throw new IOError(expandCauses(e)); }

}

@@ -1360,7 +1360,7 @@ public class ThriftServerRunner implements Runnable { getBytes(row), family, qualifier, amount); } catch (IOException e) { LOG.warn(e.getMessage(), e); - throw new IOError(e.getMessage()); + throw new IOError(expandCauses(e)); }

@@ -1619,7 +1619,7 @@ public class ThriftServerRunner implements Runnable

@@ -1724,7 +1724,7 @@ public class ThriftServerRunner implements Runnable { return ThriftUtilities.cellFromHBase(result.rawCells()); }

@@ -1745,7 +1745,7 @@ public class ThriftServerRunner implements Runnable { put.setDurability(mput.writeToWAL ? Durability.SYNC_WAL : Durability.SKIP_WAL); } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) { LOG.warn(e.getMessage(), e); - throw new IllegalArgument(e.getMessage()); + throw new IllegalArgument(expandCauses(e)); }

Table table = null;
@@ -1756,15 +1756,34 @@ public class ThriftServerRunner implements Runnable { value != null ? getBytes(value) : HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, put); } catch (IOException e) { LOG.warn(e.getMessage(), e); - throw new IOError(e.getMessage()); + throw new IOError(expandCauses(e)); }

catch (IllegalArgumentException e)

{ LOG.warn(e.getMessage(), e); - throw new IllegalArgument(e.getMessage()); + throw new IllegalArgument(expandCauses(e)); }

}
}

+ /**
+ * Join all of the messages of the "cause" throwables so we don't lose
+ * root cause information.
+ */
+ protected static String expandCauses(Throwable e) {
+ StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
+ while (e != null) {
+ System.out.println("Considering " + e);
+ String message = e.getMessage();
+ if (message != null) {
+ if (builder.length() > 0)

{ + builder.append(": "); + }

+ builder.append(message);
+ }
+ e = e.getCause();
+ }

+ return builder.toString();
+ }

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

1773	    while (e != null) {

1774	      System.out.println("Considering " + e);

Please remove the println() call above.


$ ls hbase-thrift/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift/

TestCallQueue.java		TestThriftHttpServer.java	TestThriftServer.java		TestThriftServerCmdLine.java

Is it possible to put the new test in one of the existing test classes above ?

Removed the unnecessary println() and also an unnecessary import.

It's possible. I avoided TestThriftServer (the obvious location) because that's a large test that takes a while to run. The only file there that's not a large test is TestCallQueue, which tests functionality unrelated to this change.

But I'm happy to put the test anywhere you think best. Where would you like it?

I should also point out that the large tests eventually timeout for me while trying to start a mini-cluster:

```
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.thrift.TestThriftServerCmdLine Time elapsed: 220.435 sec <<< ERROR!
java.io.IOException: Shutting down
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.JVMClusterUtil.startup(JVMClusterUtil.java:225)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.LocalHBaseCluster.startup(LocalHBaseCluster.java:446)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.MiniHBaseCluster.init(MiniHBaseCluster.java:225)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.MiniHBaseCluster.<init>(MiniHBaseCluster.java:94)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.startMiniHBaseCluster(HBaseTestingUtility.java:1016)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.startMiniCluster(HBaseTestingUtility.java:976)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.startMiniCluster(HBaseTestingUtility.java:850)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.startMiniCluster(HBaseTestingUtility.java:844)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.startMiniCluster(HBaseTestingUtility.java:788)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.thrift.TestThriftServerCmdLine.setUpBeforeClass(TestThriftServerCmdLine.java:121)
```

From https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6354/console :


Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.thrift.TestThriftServerCmdLine

Tests run: 32, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 58.419 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.thrift.TestThriftServerCmdLine

For now, you can keep the new test in new test class.
Nice addition. Just a minor concern. Don't you think it is better to use a new line for each cause in the chain to make things more readable?

I can see a case for it and against it. I think it depends a lot on how users will generally display their exception text. If it's printed to the console, it's probably better to use newlines. If it's written to a log-file, maybe not.

Would you prefer that I switched it to newlines?
I guess we can assume that we use log files most of the time. Current patch looks good to me too. Just curious, why do you think it is not preferable to use new line separators in log files.

Most log formats I've dealt with are pretty dumb. Generally the expectation is one entry per line and when processed by naive tools this can cause problems, like the subsequent lines not being associated with the entry. At minimum, running something like a "grep" against a log with multi-line entries won't display the entire entry.

I don't spend a lot of time working on java, though, and this may not be an issue for java loggers.
Ok. Did some digging into the exception wrapping. Found this link useful. To sum things up, I'd say let's use Throwables.getStackTraceAsString provided by guava library and get rid of unit test.

Interesting - com.google.common.base.Throwables is used by TestFilter.java

+1 on this idea.

Works for me. Please take a look at (patch 4)https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12724946/ExpandExceptionCauses4.patch

Thanks.
lgtm

Thanks!

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Compose thrift exception text from the text of the entire cause chain of the underlying exception.
